citation.article-title: Pseudonocardia spinosispora sp. nov., isolated from Korean soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudonocardia spinosispora sp. nov.
Pseudonocardia spinosispora (spi.no.si.spo'ra. L. adj. spinosus thorny; Gr. fem. n. spora seed; N.L. fem. n. spora spore; N.L. fem. n. spinosispora thorny spore)
Aerobic, Gram-positive, non-acid/alcohol-fast.
Catalase-positive.
Urease-positive.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Growth occurs between 4 and 30 °C.
Growth does not occur at or above 37 °C.
H2S production is observed.
Forms a white aerial mycelium that fragments into spiny, rod-shaped spores.
Substrate mycelium is sparse or absent on most media used.
Growth occurs only in standing culture but not in shake culture.
Produces acid from L-arabinose, D-fructose, D-glucose, D-mannose, L-rhamnose, D-xylose, adonitol, meso-erythritol, glycerol, meso-inositol and D-xylitol.
Does not decompose adenine, hypoxanthine, DL-tyrosine or xanthine.

Does not produce acid from D-cellobiose, D-galactose, D-lactose, maltose, D-melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-D-glucoside, methy α-D-mannoside, D-raffinose, salicin, L-sorbose, sucrose, D-trehalose, 2,3-butanediol, dulcitol, D-mannitol, 1,2-propanediol or D-sorbitol.
Does not hydrolyse casein, gelatin or starch.
Growth does not occur on 3% NaCl.
Type III phospholipid pattern (phosphatidylcholine is a diagnostic phospholipid).
A small amount of 10-methyl branched fatty acids (10Me-C16:0, 2.7%, and 10Me-C17:0, 1.3%) is also detected, but tuberculostearic acid or hydroxy fatty acids are not present.
The G+C content of the DNA is 70.4 mol%.
Isolated from soil from a gold mine cave near Kongju City, Korea.
The type strain is strain LM 141T (=IMSNU 50581T=KCTC 9991T=NRRL B-24156T).
